author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
review: The Great Gatsby is a timeless novel that explores the elusive American Dream through the eyes of its enigmatic protagonist, Jay Gatsby.

author: Harper Lee
review: To Kill a Mockingbird is a powerful exploration of racial injustice and moral growth in the American South, told through the eyes of young Scout Finch.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
review: The Hobbit is a charming fantasy adventure that follows the journey of Bilbo Baggins as he embarks on an epic quest to reclaim the Lonely Mountain from the dragon Smaug.

author: Paula Hawkins
review: The Girl on the Train is a gripping psychological thriller that keeps readers guessing until the very end.

author: Jane Austen
review: Pride and Prejudice is a timeless romantic comedy of manners that follows the tumultuous relationship between Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy in Georgian England.

author: Paulo Coelho
review: The Alchemist is a captivating tale of self-discovery and spiritual enlightenment as Santiago, a young Andalusian shepherd, embarks on a journey to fulfill his destiny.
